"I guess the only thing I would say is don't bet on there being more of 'Last of Us,'" Druckmann said when asked about a potential third entry. "This could be it."

It's a quite different answer from one Druckmann gave a year ago in the Grounded II: Making The Last of Us: Part II documentary. In it, Druckmann made The Last of Us: Part 3 sound likely. He said at the time there is probably "one more chapter to this story," and that for years he had been unable to find a concept for a third game in the series. However, that had recently changed, with an idea that Druckmann said would "be its own thing" yet feature a "throughline" that would potentially connect all three games.

"I don't have a story," Druckmann said in the documentary. "But I do have a concept that is, to me, as exciting as [Part] 1, exciting as 2.

Following the cancelation of The Last of Us multiplayer game in December 2023, Naughty Dog confirmed it was working on two single-player projects. One of those games, Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet, was revealed during The Game Awards last year. While many fans had assumed The Last of Us: Part III was one of the two games Naughty Dog was working on, that might not be the case.

Even if The Last of Us: Part III doesn't come to fruition, there will still be new aspects to the story for fans to discover as part of the HBO adaptation of Part II. In the Variety interview, Druckmann said there will be a number of changes compared to the game, calling it a "different version" of the story.

"I love the changes that we've made," he said. "It's a different version of that story, but its DNA is in there. Maybe more than excited, I'm really curious what their [fans] reaction will be.

Druckmann previously said that even if the show should last for several more seasons, it will not go beyond the events of the games.

The Last of Us Season 2 debuts April 17 on HBO and will consist of seven episodes total, with the story picking up five years later as Joel and Ellie find themselves growing apart following the events of Season 1. A remastered version of The Last of Us: Part II will release on PC April 3.

item.title: Translation studio Transperfect acquires support dev Technicolor Games
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamedeveloper.com/business/translation-studio-transperfect-acquires-support-dev-technicolor-games

Transperfect, a company that specializes in language services across the film and game industries, recently purchased Technicolor Games for an undisclosed fee. The new subsidiary will operate as part of Transperfect Gaming.

The company's game division provides services such as art production, QA, and audio services. Its past clients have included localization for Blizzard Entertainment and Inxile and customer support and marketing for Candivore.

In the announcement, Technicolor CEO Andy Emery said the acquisition "ensures [Technicolor's] legacy continues, reinforcing its reputation as a premier provider of art, animation, and VFX services to the global video game industry."

Based in North America, Asia, and the UK, Technicolor Games. has done animation and VFX work for Kingdom Come Deliverance II, Dragon Age: The Veilguard, and EA Sports FC 25. As part of the deal, Emery and global business VP Eric Williams will remain and join Transparent Gaming's senior leadership team.

Technicolor's India-based employees will also be moved back to its Bangalore facility to "ensure continuity of business for all clients."

This appears to be Transperfect's first video game-related acquisition since its purchase of localization company MoGi Group in 2019.

item.title: Obituary: Legacy of Kain writer Jim Curry has died
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamedeveloper.com/business/obituary-legacy-of-kain-writer-jim-curry-has-died

Jim Curry, a writer and marketing manager on Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver and the Gex series, passed away in mid-February.

In an obituary on his Facebook page, his wife Ellen revealed he had been battling an undisclosed illness for "over two years."

"It has been an exhausting, difficult, and sad struggle, and we have cherished many moments along the way," she wrote. "Jim died surrounded by family."

According to MobyGames, Curry got his start in the industry as a special advisor on 1991's Marvel Land and on the "Hometek Team" for Rolling Thunder 2 that same year. Most of his credits, such as 3D Baseball and Abomination, pertain to product marketing. Along with Soul Reaver, his writing credits include Battle Cars (as a copywriter), Blood Omen: Legacy of Kain (cinematic script editor), and Akuji: The Heartless.

Both Soul Reaver and its sequel were recently remastered in a bundle for PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4 and 5, and Xbox One and Series X|S, and serve as his final credited work.
